content: and 4 until you have 32 36 40 sts between markers 64 72 80 sts this pattern is for personal use only ©lorraine rayson 2024 s-64 m-72 l-80 searching for king sexred-toe up-v01-230824 page 5 / 27 foot set-up round k2 pm ssm1 knit to 2 stitches before side marker pm ssm2 k2 remove side marker k2 pm ssm3 k11 13 15 sts pm gm1 k6 pm gm2 knit to 2 stitches before end of round pm new bor marker remove old bor marker when you come to it working motif chart of choice work foot as follows mc k1 cc k2 mc k1 side stripe sm work motif chart for section 1 as indicated in table to marker sm mc k1 cc k2 mc k1 side stripe work motif chart for section 2a as indicated in table to marker sm mc k1 cc k1 mc k2 cc k1 mc k1 centre sole stripe sm work motif chart for section 2b as indicated in table to end of round your needle set-up is as follows bor to ssm1 4 sts side stripe ssm1 to ssm2 28 32 36 sts section 1 instep ssm2 to ssm3 4 sts side stripe ssm3 to gm1 11 13 15 sts section 2a part sole gm1 to gm2 6 sts centre sole stripe gm2 to bor 11 13 15 sts section 2b part sole 64 72 80 sts work stitches as presented for the side and centre sole stripes work motif chart for sections 1 2a and 2b continue as established working 2 mc rounds plain rounds between each motif chart maintaining the side and centre sole stripes see example 1 on how to work a motif chart and plain rounds on p 10 after you have worked more than 4 cm/1 5 inches of stranded colour work measure your row gauge over 2 5 cm/1 inch to help determine when to start the gusset continue as established until the sock is 12 5 13 5 14 5 cm/4 75 5 25 5 5 inches shorter than your foot calculated at pattern gauge ∆ ∆ the above measurements includes the 31 35 39 row of the gusset chart plus 2 additional row which are worked between the gusset and heel turn giving the total number of row to be worked of 33 37 41 these 2 additional row are short row and are worked to eliminate the unsightly blips of colour that can occur when working decreases in colour work and to close any lbj stitches note that all gusset row in the gusset chart need to be worked so take care on when you start the gusset it is better to end up with the sock a little short than too long as you can knit some additional rounds working mc between the gusset markers if needed to obtain required length depending on your personal requirements decide how many gusset increases you need for fit remembering that stranded colour work is not as stretchy
